basics.name: Ross Higa
basics.label: Student and Technology Consultant
basics.summary: I am a B.S. Computer Engineering candidate and research assistant in Mānoa at the University of Hawaii. I run RH Digital, an IT services and retail analytics firm for local businesses. When not working find me outside shooting landscapes with a Canon.

education.institution: Leeward Community College, Pearl City, HI
Moanalua Community School for Adults, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Manoa, HI - Research support for VR and ambient/context aware devices
highlights: Provide system and developer support under the direction of Dr. Darren Carlson

work.summary: Oahu, HI - RH Digital is proud to empower local business with technology and data driven strategies.
highlights: Provided clear direction, leadership, and communication necessary to achieve business, financial and operating goals
Built, repaired, and upgraded personal computers by following detailed and specific build plans
Developed engaging and visually compelling websites based on the WordPress and Concrete5 platform
Set up home office networks or business services including DNS, email, and server hosting
Develop tools to process large amounts of retail data to provide movement and market analytics

work.summary: Honolulu, HI - Reported directly to the vice president of programming to collaborate on milestone initiatives while reducing help desk ticket load
highlights: Provided direct line support for 56k, DSL, managed IP, VoIP, and colocation customers to diagnose and resolve system issues
Generated operational and financial analytics using spreadsheets, Quicken, and other data sources
Utilized Cacti, Nagios, and Zabbix to monitor IP circuits and escalate issues to NOC supervisor
Developed bash automated certificate deployment and Asterisk PBX configuration for SRTP VoIP encryption and high availability seamless route failover
Integrated open source software with various telecom vendor systems such as Verizon, 2wire, Polycom, Linksys, CloudTrax, and Pace

work.summary: Kapolei, HI - Shot once in a lifetime events for clients such as the University of Hawaii, Kamehameha Schools, and Oahu Interscholastic Association
highlights: Provided consultation to clients on creating the most appropriate style and expression to meet their expectations.
Captured over 6,000 individual photos of every undergraduate and graduate as the part of the official 2014 University of Hawaii at Mānoa Commencement Ceremony photographer team
Ensured optimal performance of systems utilizing the Xen and WHM/cPanel platforms
Configured critical services including Squid proxy, BIND, iptables, Apache httpd, PHP-FCGI, MySQL, and ProFTPD
Improved customer satisfaction by providing live customer support via chat and ticketing system
Implemented polices and optimization for shell access, brute force timeouts, SYN cookies, and TCP windows
